JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . Alleged ill - treatment and investigation
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was found guilty of aggravated infliction of bodily harm and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . The applicant began to serve his sentence in GPE prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE , due to violations of the internal prison rules , the applicant was transferred from GPE prison to GPE prison and on DATE he was transferred to Daugavpils prison .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE in NORP prison he had felt weak due to being on hunger strike , and had lain down on the floor . A prison guard had approached him and kicked him in the left knee once . DATE another prison guard kicked him in the left side CARDINAL times . Afterwards , on DATE the prison guards humiliated the applicant several times by lifting him up together with his bed and throwing it onto the floor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the prison doctor about permanent pain in his left knee allegedly caused by ill - treatment by a prison guard . According to the medical report the doctor detected a deformation in the joint of the applicant 's left knee . It also stated that the knee was not swollen and the skin of the knee was of a normal colour . It was concluded that the deformation of the applicant 's left knee was caused by chronic arthrosis . Following another medical examination on DATE the applicant was diagnosed with inflammation of the left knee joint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to ORG and on DATE he was admitted to the surgical unit of the hospital , where his previous diagnosis was confirmed .
CARDINAL . On DATE during a medical examination at the hospital the applicant complained of a swollen knee . He also stated that DATE he had fallen on his left knee .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant left the hospital after having received medical treatment and having refused to have his knee operated on .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant had applied to ORG complaining that from DATE to DATE the NORP prison guards had ill - treated him ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . He also complained to ORG about the circumstances of his transfer from NORP prison to FAC DATE , alleging that he had not been provided with nutrition during the transfer .
CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor from ORG met with the applicant in private and obtained statements from him .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a forensic medical report on the applicant 's knee injury .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent forensic medical tests . The medical expert 's referred to the applicant 's medical history by stating , inter alia , that in DATE the applicant has complained about pain in spine and his right leg . In order to reach a conclusion the experts requested additional medical records from ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claim concerning the conditions of his transfer to FAC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the forensic medical expertise concluded that the swelling in the applicant 's left knee was associated with chronic changes to the knee joints caused by deforming arthrosis and bursitis .

CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor of ORG decided not to initiate criminal proceedings regarding the alleged ill - treatment in NORP prison . The decision was supported by the results of the expert report and the results of the internal investigation undertaken by the head of NORP prison . According to the latter , on DATE , DATE and DATE prison guards had inspected the cell without using any force against the applicant . The applicant did not appeal against the decision to a prosecutor of a higher rank .
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant was repeatedly admitted to ORG concerning his joint disease .
CARDINAL . Alleged inference with the applicant 's right to respect for his correspondence

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE he complained to ORG that the PERSON prison administration had confiscated complaints he had drafted to various ORG institutions . He also asked ORG to forward his letters , without specifying their contents , to ORG and the Minister of Justice . The letters to the latter authorities were in a sealed envelope attached to the letter addressed to ORG .
CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's inquiry on DATE ORG informed the applicant that it had not received his complaint of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , naming the document “ a copy of the letter of CARDINAL July DATE ” , the applicant sent to ORG an identical complaint with attached sealed letters addressed to ORG and ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked the ORG prison authority to examine the applicant 's complaints , whereas the letters addressed to other ORG institutions were returned to the applicant informing him that they could be sent at his own expense directly to the recipients .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied to the applicant on the merits of his complaint of DATE , which was allegedly the copy of the letter from DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant repeatedly asked ORG to forward a sealed envelope to ORG .
CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's inquiry on DATE ORG informed the applicant that it had not received his complaint of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG received letters from the applicant .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of the code convicted persons have the right to write proposals , submissions and complaints to ORG institutions , public organisations and officials . Proposals , submissions and complaints of convicted persons shall be sent to the appropriate persons and decided in accordance with the procedures prescribed by law . Proposals , submissions and complaints addressed to the prosecutor shall not be monitored and shall be dispatched within TIME ( as worded at the material time ) .
